english: to practice; to study; habit; to get used to

etymology.description: 會意: 羽 “wings” + 日 “sun” (later 日 → 白). Alternatively analyzed as 形聲: semantic 日 “sun” + phonetic 彗.
etymology.interpretation: Early forms picture wings with the sun, evoking repeated practice like a fledgling learning to fly. Later scripts replaced the sun with white, and the simplified 习 compresses the form but keeps the sense of habitual learning or practice.
etymology.simplification: PRC 1956 scheme simplified 習 to 习 by eliminating the 白 component and collapsing the 羽 elements, reducing strokes for ease of writing; this new simplified form was not attested before the reform.

examples.chinese: 我已经习惯早起(我已經習慣早起)。
examples.english: I'm already used to getting up early.

examples.chinese: 她每天练习书法(她每天練習書法)。
我们在图书馆学习中文(我們在圖書館學習中文)。
examples.english: We study Chinese in the library.
